intro: Ballota acuta var. bullata, commonly known as the spiked ballota, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Leguminosae (Fabaceae) family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet having a serrated margin, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Ballota acuta var. bullata is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional use in herbal medicine.
